prompt: Where is Island Hall?
completion: Island Hall is located at 11 Curlew Drive, Corpus Christi. Here the Google Maps link: [URL]

prompt: What are the library hours?
completion: The library is open from 8 AM to 10 PM on weekdays and 10 AM to 6 PM on weekends.

prompt: How can I find the National Spill Control School?
completion: The National Spill Control School is located in the Carlos Truan Natural Resources Center, 6300 Ocean Drive, Corpus Christi.

prompt: Where can I park on campus?
completion: Student parking is available in designated lots around campus, including areas near the University Center.

prompt: What facilities are available at Texas A&M University-Corpus Christi?
completion: The university offers facilities such as the library, Island Hall, research labs, recreation centers, and more.

prompt: How do I get to the University Center from Island Hall?
completion: To get to the University Center from Island Hall, head south on Curlew Drive, then take a right on Ocean Drive. The University Center is located just a short walk ahead.

prompt: Who can I contact for information on campus tours?
completion: For campus tours, please contact the admissions office at Texas A&M University-Corpus Christi at admissions@tamucc.edu or call (361) 825-5700.

prompt: Are there any dining options on campus?
completion: Yes, there are dining options in the University Center and several caf√©s around campus offering meals and snacks.

prompt: Is there a campus map available?
completion: Yes, you can access the campus map here: [URL]. It includes all buildings and parking areas.

prompt: Where can I find the Recreation Center?
completion: The Recreation Center is located on Sandpiper Drive, adjacent to the University Center. Here the Google Maps link: [URL].

prompt: What is the contact information for the admissions office?
completion: You can reach the admissions office at admissions@tamucc.edu or call (361) 825-5700 for any inquiries.

prompt: How do I access student support services?
completion: Student support services are available at the University Center, Room 107, or you can contact them at support@tamucc.edu.

prompt: What are the library quiet study areas?
completion: The library offers designated quiet zones on the 2nd and 3rd floors for individual study.

prompt: How can I schedule an appointment with my advisor?
completion: You can schedule an appointment with your advisor via the student portal or by contacting the advising office at advising@tamucc.edu.

prompt: Where is the main entrance of Texas A&M University-Corpus Christi?
completion: The main entrance is located at 6300 Ocean Drive, Corpus Christi, right off Ocean Drive.

prompt: What are the operating hours of the university library?
completion: The library is open from 8 AM to 10 PM on weekdays, and 10 AM to 6 PM on weekends.

prompt: How can I find the science building?
completion: The science building is located near the University Center on Curlew Drive. Here's a Google Maps link for directions: [URL].

prompt: Who should I contact for admissions information?
completion: For admissions, you can email admissions@tamucc.edu or call (361) 825-5700.

prompt: Where can I park on campus as a visitor?
completion: Visitor parking is available near the University Center and the Performing Arts Center, with metered and free parking zones.

prompt: What study areas are available in the library?
completion: The library offers quiet study areas on the 2nd and 3rd floors, with group study rooms available for reservation.

prompt: Where can I get my student ID card?
completion: Student ID cards can be obtained at the University Center's Information Desk during business hours.

prompt: Are there food options on campus?
completion: Yes, there are several dining options in the University Center, including a cafeteria and coffee shops.

prompt: Where is the National Spill Control School located?
completion: The National Spill Control School is located at the Carlos Truan Natural Resources Center on campus.

prompt: What is the best way to get from Island Hall to the University Center?
completion: Head south on Curlew Drive, then turn right onto Ocean Drive. The University Center will be ahead on the left.

prompt: How can I get involved in campus clubs?
completion: You can join campus clubs by attending the Student Organization Fair or by visiting the Office of Student Engagement.

prompt: What are the library's printing services?
completion: The library offers printing and scanning services on the 1st floor. You can use your student ID to pay for printing.

prompt: Who can help with IT issues?
completion: For IT support, contact the IT Help Desk at (361) 825-2692 or visit their office in the University Center, Room 201.

prompt: Where can I find campus security?
completion: Campus security offices are located near the entrance of the University Center and are available 24/7.

prompt: What types of recreational facilities are available on campus?
completion: Recreational facilities include a gym, swimming pool, and sports courts, located in the Recreation Center.

prompt: Is there a place to buy textbooks on campus?
completion: Yes, textbooks and other supplies are available at the campus bookstore, located in the University Center.

prompt: How do I apply for on-campus housing?
completion: To apply for housing, visit the Housing Office website or contact them at housing@tamucc.edu.

prompt: What health services are available on campus?
completion: The campus health center offers basic medical services, located in the Sandpiper Building. Call (361) 825-2600 for appointments.

prompt: Where can I find career services?
completion: Career Services is located in the University Center, Room 304, offering resume workshops, internships, and job placements.

prompt: Where can I find maps of the campus?
completion: Campus maps are available online or at the Information Desk in the University Center.

prompt: Where is the library located?
completion: The library is located in the Mary and Jeff Bell Library building on the main campus, next to the University Center.

prompt: How can I get to the cafeteria?
completion: To reach the cafeteria, head to the University Center. The dining hall is located on the first floor.

prompt: Can you show me the way to Island Hall?
completion: Island Hall is located on Curlew Drive. From the main entrance, head south and take a left at the first intersection.

prompt: What is the contact number for admissions?
completion: You can contact the admissions office at Texas A&M University-Corpus Christi by calling (361) 825-5700.

prompt: Are there any parking lots near the engineering building?
completion: Yes, there are parking lots near the engineering building, including Lot 15 and Lot 16, located north and west of the building.

prompt: What time does the library close today?
completion: The library usually closes at 11:00 PM on weekdays. However, it is best to check the library is website for specific hours.

prompt: Where can I find student health services?
completion: Student Health Services is located in the Sandpiper Building. From the main entrance, walk straight past the library, and you will see it on your right.

prompt: Where can I park on campus as a visitor?
completion: Visitors can park in designated visitor parking areas, such as Lots 1 and 2 near the main entrance. Be sure to display a visitor parking permit.

prompt: What facilities are in the Dugan Wellness Center?
completion: The Dugan Wellness Center offers gym facilities, an indoor track, a swimming pool, and various fitness classes for students and faculty.

prompt: How do I get to the National Spill Control School?
completion: The National Spill Control School is located in the Carlos Truan Natural Resources Center on campus. Head north from the main entrance to reach it.

prompt: Where is the nearest bus stop on campus?
completion: The nearest bus stop is located near the entrance to the University Center, on Ocean Drive.

prompt: What are the fees for using the campus gym?
completion: The campus gym is free for all students. Faculty and staff must pay a membership fee, which can be found on the Recreation Center website.

prompt: How do I request a transcript?
completion: You can request your transcript through the Registrar website or by calling (361) 825-2624.

prompt: Where can I buy tickets for campus events?
completion: Tickets for campus events are available at the University Center Ticket Office or online at the TAMUCC website.

prompt: What time do classes start in the morning?
completion: Morning classes typically start at 8:00 AM, but check your class schedule for exact times.

prompt: Is there a shuttle service on campus?
completion: Yes, the university provides shuttle services between major campus buildings. Shuttle schedules are available on the campus website.

prompt: Where is the counseling center?
completion: The Counseling Center is located in the Sandpiper Building, Room 206. You can call (361) 825-2703 for appointments.

prompt: What are the computer lab hours?
completion: The computer labs in the library are open from 8 AM to 10 PM on weekdays and 10 AM to 6 PM on weekends.

prompt: How do I contact the financial aid office?
completion: You can contact the Financial Aid Office at (361) 825-2338 or visit them in the University Center, Room 150.

prompt: Where can I find the student newspaper?
completion: The student newspaper is available in print at the University Center or can be accessed online at the TAMUCC website.

prompt: How can I get a campus map?
completion: Campus maps are available at the Information Desk in the University Center or on the university official website.

prompt: Is there a bike rack on campus?
completion: Yes, bike racks are available near the University Center and most major academic buildings.

prompt: What is the emergency number for campus security?
completion: In case of an emergency, call campus security at (361) 825-4444.

prompt: Where can I find the writing center?
completion: The Writing Center is located in the library, Room 111, offering tutoring services for writing assignments.

prompt: What student organizations are available on campus?
completion: There are various student organizations such as academic clubs, cultural groups, and volunteer organizations. Check the Student Activities website for a full list.

prompt: Where is the parking lot for faculty and staff?
completion: Faculty and staff parking is available in the lot behind the University Center and near the library.

prompt: How do I book a study room in the library?
completion: You can book a study room through the library online reservation system or at the front desk.

prompt: What is the address for the campus administration office?
completion: The campus administration office is located at 6300 Ocean Drive, Corpus Christi, in the University Center.

prompt: Are there any international student clubs?
completion: Yes, there are several international student clubs. You can contact the Office of International Programs for more details.

prompt: Where can I find a list of campus events?
completion: A list of campus events is available on the university events page and on flyers around campus.

prompt: How can I apply for on-campus housing?
completion: You can apply for on-campus housing through the Housing and Residential Life website. Make sure to apply early for the best selection of dorms.

prompt: Where is the nearest ATM on campus?
completion: There are several ATMs on campus, including one in the University Center and one near the Island Hall.

prompt: What are the campus dining hours?
completion: Campus dining facilities have varying hours. The University Center Dining Hall is open from 7:00 AM to 8:00 PM, Monday through Friday.

prompt: Can I rent a locker on campus?
completion: Yes, lockers are available for rent at the Recreation Center. You can inquire at the front desk for availability and prices.

prompt: How do I get to the Coastal Bend Business Innovation Center?
completion: The Coastal Bend Business Innovation Center is located at 6101 Ayers Street. You can take the campus shuttle or drive directly.

prompt: Where is the student health center?
completion: The Student Health Center is located at 6320 Ocean Drive, Corpus Christi. You can call (361) 825-2601 for more information.

prompt: How do I check my grades?
completion: You can check your grades through the student portal, which requires your student ID and password to log in.

prompt: Is there a quiet place for studying on campus?
completion: The library is a quiet place for studying, with several silent study areas available on the second and third floors.

prompt: Where can I buy textbooks for my classes?
completion: Textbooks can be purchased at the University Bookstore or through online vendors. You can also rent textbooks for some courses.

prompt: How can I change my class schedule?
completion: You can change your class schedule through the student portal during the add/drop period. Contact your academic advisor if you need help.

prompt: Where is the TAMUCC bookstore?
completion: The TAMUCC bookstore is located in the University Center. You can also visit their online store to purchase textbooks and other supplies.

prompt: What time does the library close?
completion: The library is open from 8:00 AM to 10:00 PM on weekdays and 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM on weekends. The hours may vary during holidays.

prompt: Where can I find parking for visitors?
completion: Visitor parking is available in the University Center parking lot and other designated areas on campus. You can get a visitor parking permit at the Information Desk.

prompt: How can I get a student ID card?
completion: You can get your student ID card at the University Center during regular business hours. Bring a photo ID and your student information.

prompt: Where can I find a study group for my biology class?
completion: You can join study groups through the Biology Department website or connect with other students on the campus online community platform.

prompt: What is the best way to get to the campus from the airport?
completion: You can take a taxi or use a ride-sharing service like Uber or Lyft from the airport. The campus is about a 15-minute drive away.

prompt: How do I report a campus maintenance issue?
completion: You can report maintenance issues through the Facilities Management website or by calling (361) 825-2600.

prompt: Are there any volunteer opportunities on campus?
completion: Yes, there are several volunteer opportunities available through the Office of Student Engagement and local community service organizations.

prompt: How do I get a letter of recommendation from a professor?
completion: You can request a letter of recommendation by contacting your professor directly, preferably with enough notice for them to write the letter.
